channel.title: [317]Server From Scratch[317]
channel.description:
[size=12pt]Ok, so i have heard that making a 317 private server from scratch is hard. Now i don't mean downloading a source then putting it into a client, i mean start from a blank folder with nothing in it. Now i just want to take a whack at it and try to get some knowledge in my head. Does anyone know how to start or what i should start with. It would also be helpful if someone could also help me with doing this.
Thanks[/size]

item.title: [317]Server From Scratch[317]

dude i wanted to try this. but everyone is like, its not possible for someone like you, so i support you. dont stop believin lol. but ya. it takes a long time. http://www.runelocus.com/forums/forumdisplay.php?f=13

item.title: [317]Server From Scratch[317]
item.dc:creator: @Fall Fall
item.description:
@Fall wrote:

if all of you are talking about java such as…

booleans,
chars,
bytes,
ints,
floats,
etc.

I know some of that and if i cant figure something out about java, i would try another server help or look at the guide on the tutorial list.

BTW I looked at the login protocol. And just to make sure is it this?

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Server From Scratch[317]
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Its the server class that starts everything not the client class. Also if your going to start from scratch at least don’t use the Stream and Cryption classes we are using. Blake released both of them on on R-S they are a lot better, legal, and are not shit, also to learn a bit better Java then most of the WL releases I would suggest you look into Hyperion and learn the protocol from there also. You will also learn how to use a API and better Java coding conventions.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Server From Scratch[317]
item.dc:creator: @deathschaos9 DeathsChaos9
item.description:
@deathschaos9 wrote:

You could Google RS2 Login Protocol, but honestly, if you have no experience with networking/standard IO this will more than likely prove to be a waste of time. I’m not trying to put you down or anything, but this a daunting task.

Read full topic

item.title: [317]Server From Scratch[317]
item.dc:creator: @Fall Fall
item.description:
@Fall wrote:

[quote=“deathschaos9, post:8, topic:341524”][quote author=Fall link=topic=437923.msg3218368#msg3218368 date=1274921185]

you can start with server.java and then client.java Good luck
[/quote][quote author=alpha 0nx link=topic=437923.msg3218359#msg3218359 date=1274920551]
I would highly recommend starting with client.java… this is basically your server’s heart and brain. I would like to see more people with your enthusiasm. I wish you extremely good luck!

Well thanks for getting my hopes up of starting this server and not saying junk about it.
[size=6pt]… not like those other 2…[/size]

Do any of you know the coding to server.java or client.java to start off with.

Thanks again
[/quote]

You don’t start with a specific file… Read up on RS2 Login Protocol or you won’t make it past port listening.[/quote]

Where would that be located?

Read full topic
